result.execSummary:
The defendant Mathew J. Carlson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Huber for all purposes
Commence on/before
Bond continued until he reports

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: No appearance or payment of fine, court orders warrant
Defendant Mathew Carlson in court. Defendant states he just obtained job and can have fines paid soon. Review hearing scheduled for June 6, 2016.

Defendant Mathew J. Carlson in court with attorney Sheila Janelle Kessler.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
10:03
Calling 15cm310 and 15cm71 - State moves to dismiss 15cm371 in its entirety- Granted - 
Plea questionnaire filed - No contest plea -   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty
Michlig/Kessler/Defendant/Court statement to sentencing - 
Court sentences to 120 days jail - CC/CV/DNAAS - $443 total - sumbit DNA sample - 2 days credit- submit on /before 8-28 12pm - bail will continue until he reports
Appeal rights given 
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).

  Review hearing scheduled for February 15, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

1:37 p.m. Defendant Mathew J. Carlson in court.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant states he has contacted PD's office and is eligible.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm. Bail continued. Adj. 1:38 p.m.
no intoxicants in any amount in any location, no taverns

01:50 pm - Defendant Mathew J. Carlson in court, via video, in custody.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Intra Circuit to BR I.  Defendant states Shelia Kessler represents on underlying case - Court directs defendant to contact PD regarding representaiton.    In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - Bednar statement to bail - Court sets $ sig bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
